title: Mathematical Instructional Design to Improve Welfare Attitudes Through Animal Behavior Data Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of elementary education curriculum, basic animal welfare concept comprehension, foundational statistics (averages/graphs) and data interpretation skills
context.additional_context: A collaborative instructional design process for pre-/in-service elementary teachers, targeting animal behavior data analysis and fostering attitudes toward welfare. Emphasis on activities using measurement and calculation tools in smartphone-based learning environments.

learning_goals: Learners create a lesson design plan applying the Five Freedoms animal welfare principles expressed as mathematical models (e.g., probability distributions) to educational contexts.

Through collaborative discussion activities, learners analyze animal behavior observation data as graphs/statistics and propose ≥3 ethical judgment criteria (e.g., using mean values and standard deviations).

Post-learning, ≥80% of participants show a ≥30% improvement in willingness to implement animal welfare education compared to pre-learning, confirmed by statistical significance testing (p-value <0.05).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
